meanings.definition: To hoist or haul using a winch.
meanings.sent1: The workers were winching the heavy crate onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: They winched the boat out of the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The winching of the treasure chest made the pirates cheer.
meanings.sent4: She winched her spirits up after a tough day.
meanings.sent5: Winching the flag to the top of the pole signaled victory.

meanings.definition: The act of using a winch to lift or pull something.
meanings.sent1: The winching of the car from the ditch was a team effort.
meanings.sent2: We heard the winching of the elevator as we waited for our turn.
meanings.sent3: The winching of the piano up the stairs was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: His winching of the heavy load was like watching a superhero in action.
meanings.sent5: The winching of the anchor brought the boat to a halt.

meanings.definition: A device used for hoisting or hauling heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The winching was essential for moving the logs in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The winching on the ship was well-maintained for safety.
meanings.sent3: The winching in the factory made work easier for the workers.
meanings.sent4: The winching resembled a giant hand lifting the load effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The winching at the construction site was a fascinating process to watch.
